channel.title: The New York Times Trends
channel.description: 用中文浏览纽约时报热门报道

item.title:
About 10% to 30% of people infected with the coronavirus may develop long-term symptoms, studies estimate. And four factors appear to increase the risk.
Here's what we know about how long Covid takes inside the body — and why it can be so debilitating. https://t.co/5ZHYg9604w
Breaking News: The police arrested demonstrators at gunpoint near the Parliament building in Ottawa in an effort to end the weekslong protests. https://t.co/vDeUauVZFh

Exclusive: Who's behind QAnon?
Computer scientists say they have identified two men as its likely authors — including one of the first online commentators to call attention to the messages that shaped the viral movement. https://t.co/ScyDqbbNAu https://t.co/nLOjpFA9Uu

Ottawa police moved in to arrest protesters on Friday, with at least 15 people arrested as of midday. Tow trucks whose license plates had been removed and company names covered with Ottawa police stickers were beginning to tow protesters’ trucks away. https://t.co/hAu4zRQPVQ

Watching 15-year-old Kamila Valieva and her 17-year-old teammates suffer on TV after the free skate on Thursday has prompted some to ask if raising the minimum competition age at the Olympics would help protect young athletes from abuse and humiliation. https://t.co/X9LqRtHYZH
A federal judge ruled that three civil lawsuits against Donald Trump over the Capitol attack can proceed, denying the former president's claims of immunity. https://t.co/L8Wd6uM6Ri
Breaking News: The U.S. has intelligence that President Vladimir Putin has decided to invade Ukraine and target the capital Kyiv, President Biden said. https://t.co/ugjStlEgVh

During the Berlin airlift of 1948, Lt. Gail Halvorsen helped drop 23 tons of candies, chocolate and chewing gum wrapped in tiny parachutes to the children of West Berlin. He became known as the “Candy Bomber.” He died this week at 101. https://t.co/ykfKFmSXQl

Hundreds of police moved in to arrest protesters in Ottawa on Friday, hoping to end weeks of gridlock. Anticipation grew as demonstrators heard reports of police cruisers amassing nearby. “They’re going to corral us,” one man said.
Read the latest. https://t.co/Hi2cgG2eB6 https://t.co/ym28EAY89u

A Marine Corps reservist who was charged with entering the U.S. Capitol during the Jan. 6 riot is now accused of conspiring with a nurse to steal, forge and distribute hundreds of fake Covid vaccination cards, prosecutors said. https://t.co/jc9Qq1tjcZ

Breaking News: The National Archives confirmed that it had found classified information among documents that Donald Trump took with him when he left the White House, and that it had consulted with the Justice Department about the matter. https://t.co/U3e707gYKo

Breaking News: Kim Potter, the ex-police officer who killed Daunte Wright, saying she mistook her gun for a Taser, was sentenced to two years for manslaughter, far less than the standard sentence of about seven years. https://t.co/FrIgo5Fb4r

The U.S. said Russia had likely amassed as many as 190,000 troops near Ukraine’s borders, significantly raising its estimate of the buildup. It is “the most significant military mobilization in Europe since the Second World War,” officials said. https://t.co/8hnxduxJmQ

Markus Dohle, the chief executive of Penguin Random House, will personally donate at least $500,000 to the free-speech organization PEN America in an effort to combat book banning in the U.S., PEN announced on Wednesday. https://t.co/H2IfCsKY1m

A mammoth cargo ship believed to be carrying thousands of vehicles including 1,100 Porsches was on fire and drifting off the coast of the Azores on Thursday after its 22 crew members were rescued from the vessel. https://t.co/tSsMhlim89

Eileen Gu just won medal 🥇 number 🥈 three 🥇
The star skier, who grew up in California and competes for China, won gold in the freeski halfpipe, her third medal at #Beijing2022. https://t.co/5l861oZxlK https://t.co/nv2yCAR9K2
“The appearance of what is racially disparate treatment,” Gov. Philip Murphy of New Jersey said at a news conference on Wednesday, “is deeply, deeply disturbing.” https://t.co/NFU9ZGtRXA
Breaking News: The police in Canada began moving in to make some arrests in Ottawa, including Tamara Lich, one of the trucker protests’ main organizers. https://t.co/8344xT50G4

Nobody seems to have had more fun in this Olympic women’s figure skating event than Alysa Liu 🇺🇸 She floated through her free skate program, beaming with joy the entire time.
The 16-year-old moved into first place. https://t.co/ewDkTvz1BC

An artillery strike damaged a kindergarten and wounded three adult civilians in east Ukraine, the Ukrainian military said. It blamed “occupation” forces, suggesting the strike was by Russia-backed separatist troops who have long operated in the region. https://t.co/fANFSrluOf

An anime convention held in Manhattan last November was not a superspreader event, a new CDC study found. Good air filtration, widespread vaccination and masks indoors prevented the 53,000-person event from causing a major Covid outbreak, the agency said. https://t.co/IT2ZIZVXgk

An Omicron subvariant that scientists believe is even more contagious is on the rise, the WHO said. It has become dominant in several Asian countries, but a decline in coronavirus testing is muddling the global picture. https://t.co/2UXsrBT3m1

Breaking News: Spotify lured Joe Rogan with a $200 million deal, double initial reports. It made the company a podcasting giant. But controversy followed, putting the company at the center of a fiery debate about misinformation and free speech. https://t.co/gOsaKRKYmr

Breaking News: The New York attorney general Letitia James can question Donald Trump and two of his children in a civil inquiry into his business practices, a judge ruled, rejecting Trump's effort to block the questioning. https://t.co/dgCGpnYZvc

Kamila Valieva, the Russian figure skating star who is at the center of doping questions at #Beijing2022, was expected to win the women’s individual event.
But after stumbling and falling during her routine, she finished fourth. https://t.co/5IMXWueiQC https://t.co/zkuwC9gFoE

A 13-year-old girl was held in a juvenile-detention center for 11 days after a classmate impersonated her on social media to make threats against their school. Now, her family has filed a lawsuit against the school and Instagram for failing to protect her. https://t.co/RwxMVSpfwO

Police are threatening to arrest protesters blocking roads in Canada. U.S. truckers are planning their own protest. @sheeraf discusses the situation with @SarahMaslinNir in Ottawa and @porterthereport in Toronto. Join us now. https://t.co/tkEOXEBxAa

Canada: The new Olympic champions in women's ice hockey. 🏒
The Canadians beat the U.S. in the gold medal game, 3-2, reclaiming the Olympic crown that the Americans had earned four years ago. https://t.co/xlzt7zlSpm https://t.co/vadM4UDwSE

A private equity investor who paid more than $1.2 million to secure the admission of his three children to elite universities as purported athletic recruits was sentenced on Wednesday to 15 months in prison. https://t.co/5oFzDfPNe4
Breaking News: A senior U.S. official accused Russia of lying about its pullback, saying Moscow added over 7,000 troops to Ukraine’s borders in recent days. https://t.co/DWoX7ggKHz
Breaking News: San Francisco voters ousted three members of the Board of Education in a recall election fueled by pandemic anxiety and anger. https://t.co/xmPEjL7G2O

Police are threatening to arrest protesters blocking roads in Canada. U.S. truckers are planning their own protest. @sheeraf discusses the situation with @SarahMaslinNir in Ottawa and @porterthereport in Toronto on Wednesday, Feb. 16, at 5 p.m. ET. https://t.co/tkEOXEBxAa

Tuesday's cyberattack on Ukraine's defense ministry, army and banks was the largest of its kind in the country's history, a Ukrainian official said. And the head of the cyber security department of Ukraine's intelligence agency said Russia was to blame. https://t.co/sYp3JuIiO7

The 15-year-old Russian figure skater Kamila Valieva said she was taking substances to treat a heart ailment. But experts say two of the drugs detected in her blood aren't regularly used in cardiology. https://t.co/FAMskbOe1t

An investigation was launched after a Harvard University graduate student accused a professor of sexually harassing her. What happened next stunned her.
Harvard obtained her therapy notes and gave them to the professor, according to a lawsuit. https://t.co/X58Uo6dx3v
Infants whose mothers received two doses of an mRNA vaccine during pregnancy are less likely to be hospitalized for Covid in the first six months of life, a CDC study found. https://t.co/xSESfx2RXK

Breaking News: President Biden, rejecting Donald Trump’s executive privilege claim, is ordering the release of White House visitor logs to the Jan. 6 panel. He informed the National Archives that the logs should be turned over within 15 days. https://t.co/HHx3ORSA0N
Our bodies were “not designed for the kinds of stressors that we face today,” a social psychologist said. Here’s how to recognize burnout in your body and what to do about it. https://t.co/D5OsMmgLHJ

Valérie Pécresse, a candidate for president of France, used the phrase "great replacement," referencing a racist conspiracy theory, in a speech over the weekend, fueling criticism from both her opponents as well as allies within her party. https://t.co/c7zxpRNko3

Why are truckers blocking roads in Canada? What's happening now? Will the protests spread to the U.S.? @sarahmaslinnir is on the scene and will discuss the latest developments with @porterthereport and @sheeraf on Wednesday, Feb. 16, at 5 p.m. ET. https://t.co/tkEOXET8rI
Coachella will not require attendees to wear masks — or be vaccinated or tested for the coronavirus — when the festival returns for the first time in two years this April. https://t.co/Q9nhHL0U5a

A woman of mixed race appears to be the third person ever to be cured of HIV, using a new transplant method involving umbilical cord blood that could make a cure available to more people of diverse racial backgrounds, scientists announced on Tuesday. https://t.co/kuGXmL94oZ https://t.co/IeYO4grOIB

The pastor of a Catholic church in Phoenix incorrectly performed thousands of baptisms over more than 20 years by changing one word in the ritual, a church investigation found.
“I deeply regret my error,” said the pastor, who has resigned. https://t.co/51WIi3lhr7
Our bodies were “not designed for the kinds of stressors that we face today,” a social psychologist said. Here’s how to recognize burnout in your body and what to do about it. https://t.co/gWo8beBfLe

The U.S. government has requested the arrest and extradition of Juan Orlando Hernández, the former Honduran president who has been accused in New York of receiving money from drug cartels. https://t.co/fLZHnulgXJ

Breaking News: The Russian figure skater Kamila Valieva had other drugs that can be used to treat heart conditions in her system before the Olympics. Only one is banned, according to documents reviewed by The New York Times. https://t.co/grTlko0msR

Dennis Hope has spent 27 years alone in a Texas prison cell smaller than a compact parking space. Last month, he asked the Supreme Court to consider setting limits on prolonged isolation under the Eighth Amendment, which bars cruel and unusual punishments. https://t.co/OuUHz6IdYH https://t.co/xFWd6LMQMy

Breaking News: A woman of mixed race appears to be the third person ever to be cured of HIV, using a new treatment that could make a cure available to more people of diverse racial backgrounds, scientists announced on Tuesday. https://t.co/MlDn6pazHl

The Royal Canadian Mounted Police said it arrested 11 people and seized a cache of weapons — including long guns, handguns, a machete, body armor and a large quantity of ammunition and magazines — linked to protesters at a border crossing in Alberta. https://t.co/jwTClIBaQe

Breaking News: Prince Andrew settled a sexual abuse lawsuit with Virginia Giuffre, one of Jeffrey Epstein’s accusers, according to a new court filing in Manhattan on Tuesday. Financial terms were not disclosed. https://t.co/TYOu3UhnuX
